INFO FROM POKÉMON WEBSITE

>Riko
>A Pokémon adoring girl hailing from the Kanto region. Transferring to the Paldea Region’s special academy to hone her skills in all manners of Pokemon care and knowledge. She has a special bond with Pokémon that few can understand. She has a frightening knack for battle and an easygoing attitude. She doesn’t talk much about her family with those around her and refuses to give her family name to any except the Professors of the campus. What secrets and mysteries could our protagonist be keeping and for what reason?

>Roi
>A native of the Paldea region, with a dream to become the worlds greatest Pokémon chef in order to take over his families business and to make the dream of his Father come true. He’s known around the Academia for his kind and caring nature along with his dislike of the outdoors. Unlike Riko he’s more than happy to carry his families legacy and wishes to discover the legend of the ‘Herba Mystica’ of the Paldea Region.

>>52645573
because you made the mistake of running trick room on a defensive mon that would require switching out
bulky offense mon with trickroom like Reuniclus, Victini or, from those we have access to this gen, Farigiraf, Rabsca, Hatterene, Slowking/bro or even Armarouge to some degree
you want to avoid a Bronzong or a Oranguru setting the trickroom since they're mostly support and you just end up wasting your precious trickroom turns
ideally you give them a weakness policy or a stat boosting berry and you use all of your turns blasting through their sweet mons
you said you wanted to go normal, then Farigiraf is a pretty good bet for you, on top of that it gets Armor tail to defeat the sucker punchers or Cud Chew if you want peak berry memes
switching out is a much harder thing to do in 3v3, you really want to immediatly benefit from the trickroom instead of wasting turns getting your sweeper in safely

Combination attacks like pledges but more generic and dependent on the type of the attacks.
You get two effects based on the type of the two attacks, the effect of the attack that strikes first is the stronger one. For example you can get Fire(strong)+Grass(weak) or the other way around.

>Mega (only a few mons can use it and you're force to use a special item, so having two pokémon that can mega is usually bad).
>Z-Moves, everyone can do it but the special item makes it you'll probably use the same pokémon over and over
>Dynamax, everyone can do it but it's a little too offensive
>Tera, everyone can do it

First-stage babymons can piggyback on big mons for support. Maybe have the big mon hold an item like a saddle/stroller or not. I'm not sure.
Either way, they can both use a move in a turn (maybe have the babymon be limited to a much lower level or not allowed to use attacking moves so it doesn't have a big offensive output) and share their abilities.
So for example, Bulbasaur can ride on Charizard, making it so the pair has both Chlorophyll and Solar Power. Bulbasaur can use Synthesis, the powder moves, and screens, etc.
Or use Grass Pledge to boost Charizard's Fire Pledge if it can use offensive moves.
Not only would this be interesting for battle, but also for marketing, letting the cute NFE mons be useful.
It could be any pair of mons, or be restricted to specific pairs (such as Charizard + Bulbasaur, Venusaur + Squirtle, and Blastoise + Charmander).

Kalos? The main pathway is even shorter than BW1, but the optional areas are pretty decent.
Alola? Honestly not sure what to call the final route here.
Galar? Mostly a straight line.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52650893
This is very true, but I think routes can accomplish more than just the bare minimum.
I know XY vs. BW shitflinging is old by now, but bear with me, my intent here isn't to shit on XY, but illustrate a point, and this is a fairly simple example for it.
We can pretty much agree that even by first route standards XY having absolutely nothing in it is shit. Sure, it serves a purpose, to bridge the two towns together without wild encounters so you can get there for the starters.
In contrast, you have BW. When you first start, it's just a regular first Route. Some patches of grass, so NPCs to talk with etc.
But there's a whole second section you can only access after you get Surf, leading to a decently large optional area.
It does more than the bare minimum, without an loss in regards to the primary purpose. No reason XY couldn't have that too. (And yes, basically every other first route too)
Again, I'm not saying the HAVE to do that either.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52659736
If you exclude the entire second island, most of the maps are pretty good, although there's plenty that are tiny/barren and only really justify their existence by being optional. If you include the second island, there's really just a bunch of mostly straight lines that don't offer much interesting exploration but are just long enough to be annoying and occasionally require putting a Pokemon Center in the middle of it. Like, say what you will about the "next to bridge" routes in Unova, but they're mostly short little bursts before a bridge which while not mechanically interesting at least are all aesthetically different, mostly have some decent optional content on them, and also have an in universe reason to be designed the way they are.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52647109
Ok, you start.

People are losing their mind over Kalos Rt.1 but honestly it makes its job. It's straight, short but colorful route that Gamefreak used to showcase then revolutionary leap in graphics for Pokemon games. It's like a fashion catwalk but focus is on scenery and graphics advancements... but with its camera movement it is one of the best places to look at your character and with character customization it can work as actual catwalk!

It's not supposed to be like first routes in every other game, that role was relegated to Rt.2.

>>52651368
I personally feel like Sada was cooler than Turo, and while my dick tingles are a part of it, I don't think that's the whole reason why.
There is an interesting contrast between a cavewoman obsessed with the past using modern technology to bring it to the present. It's an interesting juxtaposition. It's also more interesting because the mother is supposed to be this caring nurturing parent while the father is almost expected to be absent all the time, this is the same series where most protagonists never meet their father at all. So Sada being this shitty mom to Arven is that extra bit more significant.
If you choose to believe the theory that the third legend is some lovecraftian dreammaker who merely manipulated her to do its bidding by using false pretenses that she, arven and (probably) turo could live together the story becomes that much more fucked up. Though all of this is true for Turo as well I guess.

It sucks that the DLC will probably not do the possibilities justice. Hell, we could possibly get something completely unrelated to these unresolved plotpoints like Kalos like so many retards on here want. Or in the worst case scenario we could truly get the Kalos experience by not getting a DLC or third version at all.

>>52651368
It's a really tough call between this and the Volo/Giratina fight
The professor/AI is a really interesting character but only really gets focus in the endgame aside from bits and pieces during Arven's storyline. Volo is with you from the start of the game, he's practically your rival and has his own complex motivation.
The professor wins out in terms of the setting and spectacle, the time machine's arena is a really cool environment and the whole framing of them dropping Master Balls down on you with crazy new Pokémon was incredible. Volo's team on the other hand is almost Cynthia's with a remix of her theme too, and that makes you shit your pants for a different reason. It doesn't get points for originality but it's a really strong call-back that sets the tone for the kind of fight you're in for.
Now the second part of the fight where the Legendary comes in is where they go in two very different directions. Fighting Koraidon/Miraidon is a victory lap, you get the conclusion of your own bike's arc in a very satisfying and cool way. It's dressed up very well, I imagine most people who have played other RPGs that do similar things could read the situation and follow what the game wanted you to do, but ultimately it is basically a scripted fight. When Volo brings in Giratina after you beat him it's a real 6v7 fight, and when you finally do take him down he just fucking gets back up with a sick guitar riff, and you realize you're fighting a boss with a second phase in a Pokémon game right before it tears you a new asshole with Shadow Force.
TL;DR I think the Volo fight wins out for throwing real curveballs at you and Arceus in general being so fresh and interesting after the last decade of mediocrity. The Area Zero sequence as a whole though was fantastic and absolutely raised the bar for what the mainline games should aspire to in the future. Pokémon games are JRPGs and it's about time they remembered that.

That's the intended experience of the fight. I think it works better with Miraidon because like you said it has Dragon Pulse to really threaten you and you can't do shit to it because has 4x resist to Electric, so you should realize immediately that you can't win by the starting position. >>52657589
I like AI Sada more, I think Pokemon as a franchise needs more genuinely terrible women and the "original" Sada hits that sweet spot for me. That, and I think she fits better as the one who had to stay and take care of Arven but got so involved in her work that she completely neglected him and everything else for the pursuit of her research, while Turo was the one who just left.

The AI being more kind and compassionate precisely BECAUSE she's an AI and can logically see how irrational her original's thought processes are is a neat take on AI as a concept. As a human, the irrationality of things like love and will are also mirrored by the irrationality of obsession and consumption, and the original Sada(/Turo in Violet) showcased that well.

I also think if the Imagination theory is real, it's neat that the AI and the raidons end up being the same kind of being: a being born from an idea that came into their own conclusion through existence. However, the raidons get to experience the freedom the AI never can and never will

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52660585
General principles for raiding: If the raid pokemon has attacks that are super effective against you, don't bother. You will die too quickly to do anything, and eat the team's time. If you don't have STAB super effective moves against its tera type, don't bother unless you are built to tank or support. If you have EVs in Speed, don't bother, they are wasted in raids. If you have no buff, debuff or utility moves, learn one and use it first turn - Doing chip damage or even a decent chunk can be detrimental in the first turn or two because you might trigger the shield, meaning less chance for people to pop off their big hits with buffs and debuffs in place and hopefully drop it in one set of attacks. Cheering is vital. If you seem to be doing dick all damage your cheers to heal can still make you useful. And most importantly If you rin a fucking Belly Drumming Azumarill against something with Steel or Poison type attacks, kill yourself. I don't care that its tera type is Dark or Fighting, you're not going to get off the fatty slap and Play Rough combo before it kills you. Same goes for Iron Hands begging for a Ground type burial.

It's worth finding a list of moves known by the bosses so you can see beforehand if you're going to get dicked over or not. I keep a word document with which of my raid ready pokemon shouldn't be taken against what because I've got a memory like a sieve.

I really suggest training HP and your damage stat to the fullest and then using the last few to shore up the weaker of your defenses for your attacking raid pokemon. Being able to soak three hits before dying is a massive advantage over one or two in the context of raids.

>>52598753 baka at least post the rest of the OP

>post fanfics you like
>share your own fics, ask for advice, post story updates
>discuss writerly struggles with fellow writefriends

Previous Thread: >>52489416

Check out the catalog for a directory of fics from fellow writefags: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1PtN4D_9CSw8JJ9uO6v0oQqdtKEkS8aFAvfxqI96XfSE
Gallery of art drawn for stories in the thread: https://imgur.com/a/sjdck

>Can I post NSFW fics?
There are no rules against NSFW text links.

>How should I post my fics?
If it's short enough to fit into a couple of posts, posting to the thread is fine. If you want to share longer works, or if you want more permanent storage, you can link to a host: fanfiction.net, AO3, Pastebin, or Google Docs.

>I'm not a writer but I want to contribute
>Can I request something?
You're encouraged to post prompts, i.e. short snippets or greentext sequences describing your ideas. You can also expand on prompts posted by others. If writing an entire story from start to finish feels too daunting, this is a way to get started.

>I have this idea about [event/technology/...]
Feel free to post your thoughts about how specific parts of the Pokémon world function as well. Worldbuilding is always welcome.

>Can I add a fic I wrote to the catalog?
Check the catalog for the submission link. Fill out the form with all the necessary information and it will be submitted for review automatically.

We're also looking to collect ideas for fanfics as a resource for stumped writers. Feel free to throw an idea out there; someone may choose to use it themselves!
Ideabin: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1X072SSWulcC6RJRrPA6v9XtyohRybvMBl6Fh49wHsRw

I hate when the writer gives nicknames to the pokemon and there's no reminder of who's who anywhere.
"Goku and Raiden hugged their trainer after waking up"? Who the fuck is Goku? There are 6 pokemon on this team, more in the bank, the last chapter update before this one was a month or more ago, and all 6 pokemon have physical bodies they can hug with. Who the HELL is Goku?

i have a problem with getting lost in the world building (I blame troll-proofing old D&D campaigns), but I have put together a good backbone of a story.

>Story is about Blue (the female player trainer from Gen 1) as an adult
>She grew up on the Sevii Islands and started her Pokemon journey alongside Red & Green
>She never really ran into them becuase she was only in Kanto with her dad on business trips
>Her dad is secretly a Team Rocket scientist
>The events of Kyogre/Groudon waking up happen when Red would be on the Sevii Islands for the first time in FRLG
>During this time, Blue's father is killed by Archer for insubordination and she's kept from going to Kanto by her mother
>Blue, having gotten 4 badges beforehand, Blue explores the Sevii Islands and mets Moltres, who she prays to as a diety
>Blue is allowed to participate in Pokemon Stadium nto get the rest of her badges at the Gym Leader Tower
>Attracted by the large number of combattants Shadow Mewtwo arrives to cause havoc

cont.

>You should spend some time in the beginning trying to connect the reader with Blue and THEN all the disasters happen

True. When I was originally putting the story, she was already an adult and all of this was slowly revealed backstory, but I could never figure out where to shoehorn it in. >>52601513
There are fightscene breakdowns on youtube, watch them.

There’s a wealth of MMA analysis and guides, of weapons fighting tips, of tactics in war.

There’s pokemon showdown and a ton of guides on competitive battling, the meat of those are about outsmarting your opponent. You can incorporate literally any of this material, though dont get too bogged down by game mechanic or tier list bullshit.

You probably have seen, maybe read, some good fightscenes through your life. Watch them again with an analytical mind and figure out how to translate what works into your format.

And for the love of god, if you’re doing this to write well dont try to become an expert on all this infinite amount of material. Have a loose idea on what sort of feeling you want for the fight or the concept of it, and then direct your research based on that specifically to start building that one fightscene. Make loose notes and a basic timeframe as you go, otherwise you’ll get lost in the sauce and just have unwritten ideas or be researching forever.

>If you're following the current gold-digger meme, then you have her start out by wedging herself into his life post-champ, posing as wanting to "watch out for him, in case some old friends of his try to take advantage of his newfound fame and status" when, of course, she's doing so just to isolate him for herself to do just that, which he obliviously accepts; however, over time of "borrowing" money and basking in the benefits of being a famous person's gf and basically being royalty in Alola because of it, his relentless positivity makes her actually fall for him, first by making her more protective of his dumbass self, to the point where she starts to feel guilty for taking advantage of his trust and friendship before, and later taken in by his uncanny ability to unintentionally be really, really smooth with words, saying things that, to him, aren't romantic phrases, but to the listener, are (consider looking at the High Touch! doujin in Dawn General for examples of this).

That said, here's an angle you can take, because, funny enough, the two actually have an amusing dynamic to them for a ship that fits their characters, if you can capture it: One is a total Pokénut who is endlessly open and willing to try new things whereas the other is more reserved, only has a surface level interest in Pokémon, and is often unnerved by the other's extreme extroversion; the fact that both get along despite being polar opposites in personality and mood makes for great potential dynamics that grounds the both of them into a balance. And in that "balance," you have your ship.

Back again. Here is what I came up with.
It was the morning of his 16th birthday. Kai was hopeful that his parents would finally let him have a Pokémon and go off on his own to challenge gyms. Ever since he was 10 he loved watching trainers battle on TV, and in his spare time he would head out into the forest to observe the Pokémon.

“Good morning” He said to his parents, who were preoccupied with making breakfast. Still groggy from just rolling out of bed, and a little annoyed he was woken by the banging of pots and pans. He didn’t let it show, he was thankful for his parents for going out of the way to make a meal.

His parents were never thrilled with the idea of their son being a trainer. They had thought it would be a passing phase he would eventually grow out of. It’s been 6 years since he said “I want to be a trainer!”

Mom and Dad were in the kitchen getting breakfast ready. An unusual sight for this household, they were usually too busy to make a proper meal in the morning.

“Good morning, Happy birthday” Dad replied.

“Morning” Said mom, who was too preoccupied with something on the stove to give a full response.

“Why don’t you get yourself fully dressed and ready so we can start celebrating” Dad said. “By the time you’re back down breakfast will be ready and we can all sit down together.” Said dad.

The kitchen was alive with the sounds of a full meal in the works, food sizzling, kitchenware clanging and banging.

“Finally, a proper breakfast” Kai thought. He loved his Mother’s cooking, she’s a very talented cook, but she doesn’t flex her skills very often, or at least not as often as Kai would like.

“Maya should be here soon with your first gift, so make sure you’re presentable.” Added Mom. “We went through hell and high water to get it.” Said mom, turning away from the stove and acknowledging him fully for the first time.

“Sure thing Mom”

1/2.

“Finally, a proper breakfast” Kai thought. He loved his Mother’s cooking, she’s a very talented cook, but she doesn’t flex her skills very often, or at least not as often as Kai would like.

“Maya should be here soon with your first gift, so make sure you’re presentable.” Added Mom. “We went through hell and high water to get it.” Said mom, turning away from the stove and acknowledging him fully for the first time.

“Sure thing Mom”

He eagerly raced up the stairs to get himself ready. He knew that his parents had capitulated in their struggle to get him to give up on being a trainer. He knew because Maya was involved. Maya was his next door neighbor, she moved here from Unova 8 years ago with her Father. She was outgoing, and ambitious, but sometimes overbearing. Most importantly, Maya was a very talented trainer, and already had her first badge from Oreburgh City. That’s how Kai new his parents had changed their mind - if Maya was involved Pokémon were involved.

Kai and Maya were friends of circumstance, despite Kai being put off buy her general disagreeableness, their close proximity to one another essentially forced them to get along. It wasn’t all bad though, Maya would often take him along to watch her battle, other trainers or just wild Pokémon, which he absolutely loved doing. Watching Maya battle was a sight to behold, she was always totally in control of the field. Her battle vs Roark even made it into the highlight reel on T.V

Kai hurriedly got ready, he knew breakfast was almost ready and he didn’t want to keep his parents waiting since they made an extra effort to make him breakfast. He headed back downstairs as his parents were setting three places at the table.

“Thanks for doing this guys, It means a lot to me” Kai said.

“No problem sweetie” replied mom

“Is there anything you need me to do?”

“Nope! Just sit tight, everything is almost ready.”

2/3

Finally the chaotic noise of the kitchen ceased and was replaced with Mom quietly but carefully setting the table. Making sure every knife, fork, spoon, glass, plate, serving plate, etc. is in the proper place. Mom had a way of getting totally absorbed into what she was doing.

The peace was suddenly interrupted by the door slamming open

“Where’s the birthday boy, he’s gonna LOVE the gift I got him!”

Maya’s here.

The loud entry snapped Mom out of her focus. She was annoyed even more by Maya saying she alone got the gift. While it was technically true, Mom and Dad had made an agreement with Maya that she would say it was a gift from everyone. She was also here 40 minutes early.

“Welcome Maya! So good to see you! Kai, go help with her coat and I’ll run and set another place at the table for her.” Mom was very good at hiding whenever she was annoyed or upset.

Kai got up and helped her as instructed.

“Hey, thanks for coming” He said as he was helping with her jacket. He didn’t want to be so forward as to ask about the gift, but it was all that was on his mind.

“Yeah I wouldn’t miss this day for the world, let me keep my jacket” She said, brushing him off “I wanna show you your gift quickly, but act like it’s a surprise when I show you later in front of them”

The two of them stepped outside quickly. The chilly fall air was nipping at their cheeks. Maya reached into her bag and pulled out a pokeball.

“No way, are you serious?” Asked Kai.

“Yes!” Maya released the Pokémon, and a starly emerged, and began nervously flying around. “Happy birthday! He’s all yours, just be careful, he’s still not used to being in a pokeball so be extra gentle with him. He’ll warm up to you in a few days.” She recalled the starly before he could fly too far away.

2.5/3

>>52623571

Well, let's think about what dragons are in-universe: rare, powerful but difficult to train, dangerous. There's also not a lot of dragon trainers around in the game, most of the time you find them in secluded areas and late-game areas.

In the past training dragons was probably a much more dangerous, but probably more impactful thing to do in case of wars or conflict. Since it's so hard to do, it checks out that the people who could do it would band together and kinda flex their techniques and power. It's just a somewhat rare talent so it makes sense that it'd be passed down a family or small group.

Also since it's a japanese series they keep the whole lineage and tradition thing going very heavily

Check'd. First time we actually see a broken limb is with Rock Tomb, and it does shock Lee at the time. I don't mind Pokemon being a bit gorier with these sorts of fights, but I do have two objections.
>Lee gets over the savagery of these fights in no time
Much ado was made about whether he could stand to see his Vulpix get hurt, but after a few weeks of intense battling it hardly affects him at all. This process should have been much more gradual. Kids in that world can stand it because they grow up watching it like with Romans and gladiatorial games, but Lee is not only a modern American, but a zookeeper. Pitting pseudo-animals in vicious fights should make him uncomfortable to his core.
>The idea of pokemon dying in a fight is so foreign that war footage gets scrubbed off the internet
Despite pokemon pulling out the stops and using fangs, claws, poison, rocks, fire, and everything else in fights, it's implied there are NEVER any accidental casualties. I don't want the fic to be "ooh so grimdark and edgy, everyone can die!" but if you start out the story with people violently dying, then there should be at least a risk of something like that happening to a beloved pokemon. For comparison, professional boxers are limited to punching with padded gloves, with plenty of set rules, and casualties still happen sometimes. Even if pokemon are "stupid durable" that should be a sad risk of the sport.

Haven't finished my re-read on the QQ thread, but cross-posting is pretty normal in this particular community. SpaceBattles is the most popular, QuestionableQuesting was created independently but happened to coincide with SB having a wave of porn ban enforcement so it picked up a solid user base, and Sufficient Velocity was made when SB's server hardware was physically breaking down AND a blowup over a staff member being fired underhandedly so for several years people cross-posted just in case SB suffered total data loss.

Then there's the cluster of weird-ass spinoffs like the one made by the stalker who impersonated an SB mod on QQ, the one made by the OTHER stalker who's an ultra-far-left lunatic, the Luxury Gay Space Communist's "Free Speech Zone" that has closed because the owner doxxed himself on KiwiFarms (where he still posts...), and TheSietch founded by some ex-staff over conservative witch-hunting.

Plus the old basically-dead rival StarDestroyer.net, the significant but not STRONG overlap with AlternateHistory.com that's run by literally three people with some incredibly strange forum culture as a result of the catastrophic understaffing, and the consequences of being the spawning grounds of several weird fandoms.

When people talk retarded Versus bullshit, it probably goes back to SB. When people talk Familiar of Zero fanfiction, it probably goes back to SB. When people talk about WildBow's Worm, it probably goes back to SB. When people talk Planetary Annihilation Self-Inserts, it probably goes back to SB. The site is older than 4chan, seeing some absolutely absurd political shifts in lurching to the modern norms.

When questioning how the Pokemon world works, always remember that monopolization of force is a keystone of modern civilization wholly inapplicable to it due to the titular creatures. As is large-scale natural resource exploitation. By extension of these two, and readily apparent from the series, there's sod-all inter-city connectivity.

So functionally speaking, there shouldn't be a Regional military to be part of. The common defense is the general population of Trainers and Pokemon, whether that be foreign invasion or local unrest, and there's not enough connection for people to care much about "their Region". See Ash typically referring to being from Pallet Town, rarely if ever Kanto.

This is why all the psychopaths look for 670+ BST Legendaries. Because you NEED single creatures able to brute-force the Champion and roll over dozens of "normal" Trainers without pause to get anywhere with unwanted change, ON TOP OF the higher-ups' personal teams not being far from the Champion's and Elites'.

I like this ambiguity. I personally lean towards a pseudo-feudal society as each gym leader is obviously very important and each one has a retinue of various trainers. It also fits the Japanese inspiration: trainers are samurai, gym leaders are daimyos and the champion is the shogun.

Johto is the most likely other belligerent, simply because it shares a land border with Kanto (so does Sinnoh, but Sinnoh is blocked off with mountains) and there's no evidence of Kanto being involved in any remote regions. Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52587470
Only rich mulch boosts your yield. If you meant using boost mulch to get berries faster, then rich mulch is still better for that purpose since it doubles your yield (as opposed to boost mulch making your crops grow 1.5 faster), you only have to use it once per berry (while in most cases a berry will need multiple uses of boost mulch), and only costs double the price of boost mulch.

Ideally you want to use both if possible, as long as you can cover the cost in FP.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52634766
>umbreon has a psa10 pop of over 2000 cards
>zard is up huge from pre-2019 prices
>umbreon started high and only went higher

Zard is following a simple trend of demand driving a hype bubble followed by a price retraction to a new price floor significantly above where it was before. It's price is driven by true demand and scarcity.

Umbreon is following a classic hype bubble trend. It has no scarcity and its price is only fueled by people feeling that they will be missing out on it as it rises further, creating a self fulfilling prophecy. While demand is a greater driver off price than supply, neither is the driver of umbreon's price. Umbreon's price is purely driven by hype and is completely artificial. As such it is unsustainable and will collapse eventually. It's not a matter of "if" but "when"
It may not go down tomorrow, or next week or next month, but it will. Once people realize how many are out there it will go down. Once people realize that there's no reason to pay $550 for a card with >2000 psa10s, it will go down. But that can take a while.

Lastly, evolving skies is the ONLY outlier among modern. Using umbreon as an example is not really proving anything. There will always be exceptions.

>Slither wing: Larvictus

>Iron Hands: Tachiama
>Iron Valiant: Gallevoid
>Flutter Mane: Dreavusaur
>Scream Tail: Nibblyruff
>Iron Bundle: Deliborg

All the names i've come up with for paradoxes i'm using/want to use. Tried my best to keep in-line with the original species name without being too on-the-nose about their etymology (aside from Deliborg cause I just think it's too good).

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Brawnphan
Brawn + Donphan.
>Gigglyruff
Not happy with this one, but had to follow the line's naming theme
>Sushroom
Sus + mushroom. If Lechonk is okay, so is this.
>Mispterious
Mysterious + pterosaur. Deeps the "mis" from Misdreavus and Mismagius.
>Magmot
Magma + maggot.
>Magnedust
Magnet + dust. Had to keep the "magne" because the whole line has it.
>Lunagon
Luna (moon) + gon from dragon. Follows the theme of Bagon and Shelgon more.

>Tronphan
Tron + Donphan.
>Santathaws
Santa Claus + thaw because it's part water.
>Motozuna
Motor + yokozuna (highest rank in sumo)
>Andreid
Android + drei, because the Hydreigon line has a German number theme.
>Mothship
Moth + mother ship, because it's a UFO
>Automatar
Automaton + tar. Had to keep the "tar" because the whole line has it.
>Galliant
Gallant + valiant, and starts with "ga" like Gardevoir and Gallade.

This thread is for the growth of artists and those who draw for fun. If you're going to give critique, please do it constructively. Rude or blunt critiques won't help anybody.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

Please provide references in ONE image, especially when requesting something outside of the Pokémon universe. If you request something from the old Drawthread or a separate thread, COPY & PASTE the actual request instead of posting a link.

Also, be mindful that requests are done at the discretion of the artists, not on a first come first serve basis.

Please remember to save any piece of art you like from these threads, as we may never know when the archive will start deleting images again. Artists can and are recommended to post their works on other outlets for archival purposes.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52606706
Just reached Vermillion, enough for today. I'm really liking my team so far.
>Brock
Charmander Ember'd down Geodude and Growled at Onix until he was in crit range. Swapped to a Level 3 Rattata and Onix proceeded to Bide over an over as I got in 6 Tail Whips. Swapped to Beedrell and Fury Attack'd him down after a String Shot to make sure I outsped, it took forever.
>Misty
Ekans vs. Staryu went fine with the snake knowing Dig. Starmie comes out and I swap to Kadabra on a Critical Bubblebeam so lucky me, I have to swap so I go to Beedrill on an X-Defense. Two Twineedles do 80% to Starmie as it Water Guns me to just over half, I swap to Fearow on a Tackle. Fearow finished Starmie with a Peck.
Overall it's been pretty good, some nasty crits here an there but luckily no deaths.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I lied, I played some more... I lost Kadabra by trying to Confusion a Geodude so it can't blow up, turns out my Kadabra had shit Special since it didn't kill, but a critical Selfdestruct sure did.
Swapped him out for a Machop I caught in Rock Tunnel, then in Celadon I bought a Dratini and grinded it on Diglett until it evolved.
>Surge
Kadabra dealt with Voltorb and Pikachu. I swapped to Arbok on Raichu using an X-Attack, then a single dig killed it in one hit.
>Erika
Beedrill is THE counter to Erika, Twineedle does 4x damage to Victreebel and Vileplume killing in one one, well two, shots. Tangela took all of two hits to take out.
I hope I can Agility strat Sabrina with Beedrill, it's always such a nice moment.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52608730
Team's looking good!

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Classes were cancelled so... Done!
>Koga
Was swept by Machamp with Earthquake, Weezing survived but decided to eat an X-attack.
>Sabrina
Twineedle on Kadabra, set up Agility on Mr.Mime as it set up a Light Screen, then Beedrill proceeds to sweep with Twineedle. Nice.
>Blaine
Another Earthquake sweep, Arcanine survived and Toke Down'd Machamp twice.
>Giovanni
Lead with Fearow thinking the lead was Dugtrio, had to swap into Dragonair on a Stomp, proceeded to sweep the whole lot with Ice Beam. Nido's survived but both used Tackle... Red and Blue gyms are dumb.

>Lorelei
Machamp is a champ, Rock Slide and Low Kick dealt with everyone but Lapras who got a nasty hit in with Hydro Pump.
Swapped to Fearow and got clapped with another Hydro Pump. Swap again to Arbok on a miss, Dig activates a Super Potion and then two Acid's take Lapras down as it hits a Confuse Ray and a Blizzard. Closer than I would've liked.

>Bruno
Arbok Mega Drains, Digs, and Acids through everyone save for Machamp. I swap for an honor battle and Strength Bruno's Machamp down.

>Agatha
Arbok Digs through Gengar. Golbat forces a switch to Fearow on a Wing Attack and Double-Edge takes down Golbat and Drill Peck deals with Haunter. I swap to Arbok on Arbok and Dig through it and the incoming Gengar.

>Lance
An absolute sweep with Dragonite, Boltbeam is unstoppable

>Rival
Fearow two shots Pidgeot as it struggles to do damage, Alakazam gets outsped and taken out with a Double-Edge.
On Rhydon I swap to Machamp and take it down with two Earthquakes as it Hits a nasty 5-hit Fury Attack and a Leer, Arcanine goes down to an Earthquake.
Swap to Beedrill on Exeggutor and get hit with Hypnosis, Beedrill and Arbok both get worn down by bad sleep luck, Charizard burns up the palmtree.
Blastoise comes out and I swap to Mahcmap ona withdraw and Deal some nice damage with EQ but I'm low, I swap Dragonite on a Hydro Pump... thank god... and Thunderbolt for the win.

posts.com:
I had three deaths this run, Butterfree, Nidoqueen, and finally... My Blastoise "Artist". After destroying Blaine, Giovanni, and most of Pre-league Rival, he sends out Alakazam who hits a Critical Psychic killing my turtle in one shot. Ninetales comes in and finishes Alakazam and Venusaur.
I go fishing south of Fuschia and catch a Staryu, name it Diamond and train it up.

The league was uneventful.
>Lorelei
Gengar Thunders and Nightshades her mons until Jynx hits a freeze and I finish with my Recover and Surf spamming starfish.
>Bruno
Starmie.
>Agatha
Sandslash Earthquakes and Rock Slides through his team but is too weak to handle her last Gengar so Ninetales comes in and Burns up the spook.
>Lance
Thunder from Gengar on Gyrados after two misses on both sides, a Hypnosis on Dragonair and then Blizzard sweep with Starmie.

>Rival
He's cost me two of my very first pokemon, "Chemise" the Nidoqueen and "Artist" the Blastoise, this is going to be... a complete sweep with Persian spamming Slash, you'll notice she also has Water Gun for a certain rhino.

This was way tougher than it had any right to be, the good news on losing my starter is that I can start LG with Bulbasaur and FR with Squirtle and give Artist II a chance to do what his daddy couldn't.
Btw the name is a Ninja Turtles reference if you were wondering.

Probably BW's sales doing kinda shit and him having another freakout about Pokemon as a brand. You can also tell it immediately bit them in the ass because of the fucked development of SM that had them making the trials during the debugging phase and cutting a planned Kalos game because they simply lacked time and manpower, the dexcut, and SV's somewhat fucky launch, not to mention BDSP being shit out because Iwao actually managed to get a game delayed for the first time since like maybe DP.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52661184
LGPE was the best Pokemon game since HGSS. They respected your time and it wasn't a grindy slog. I would have lived if they brought most of it forward to future games and just left behind the Pokemon Go catching minigame. It had better graphics, music, and gameplay, while having the PC Box always available and wild Pokemon visible (including shinies) instead of random encounters. It really was a quiet revolution that a lot of future games learned from. I just wish they didn't stray too far from it. The washed-out low-contrast look other later games had looked awful. These had a beautiful orchestrated soundtrack and colorful environments that stuck to the anime's aesthetics. I felt like it respected my time so training a perfect team of shinies was finally possible without cheating. The more you caught a species of Pokemon, the higher your odds of a shiny specimen!

>>52662073
XY was the beginning of the end, and this isn't me hating on XY. When Ash lost the Kalos league the entire anime franchise shifted. Ash wasn't allowed to lose anymore which is why he won Alola's memeleague. After that the writers had him become the best of the best and because of that are retiring him. The big thing here is Alola, while boring as fuck, worked with establishing character beats for Ash that could be carried forward. The issue with PM is that it was so poorly done and disgusting that they never did anything with Ash and simply had him "become the best battler" and ended his story. There were so many possibilities that could have happened had they continued the old "journey" narratives instead of the school/yokaiwatch shit.

>Ash loses Kalos
>Goes to Alola for a training arc/helps establish a league there
>Goes to Galar and enters the canonical "hardest" gym challenge where the best trainer in the world is

Even if Ash won Kalos he could go to Alola, help establish a league, then go on to fight the world championships. The story is all there but because of the backlash and hard change in formula for Ashs journey things flatlined hard. Add in a shitty male companion, no clear story checkpoints and PM wound up being a disaster for what have been a simple "world tour of nostalgia."

It's mostly all positions it seems. Most Champions are mostly representatives for checking if others are of the same level as them with their strongest Pokemon. Most champions actually keep their position, the only one who relinquishes it for a new 'Frontier Brain' position is Leon.

Frontier Brains are essentially 'Champion level' trainers who are hired to make sure there aren't many people winning a top prize for beating the Frontier or Battle Tower.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Frontier Brains/Post game battle facility bosses>=Champion>Elite 4>Gym Leaders

Since it's canon that gym leaders will use weaker mons depending on where in the journey the challenger is and they'll often talk about "going all out" in post game rematches I imagine the Elite 4 and Champions are the same way, where they don't fight at 100% full strength the first time around, because becoming a champion is something they want to test you on, rather than actually stopping you from doing. Where as the frontier brains and etc all know you're a champion level trainer so they'll go all out and are the most skilled at doing so, potentially even more so than a champion. Though the relative power levels probably vary from region to region, like anon said Palmer is a higher rank than Cynthia but in ORAS it's implied that someone like Wallace(a champion level trainer) is friends with Tucker so frontier brains of Hoenn are probably all roughly that same level.

I would argue that champions are the best considering everything they have to go through. The Elite 4 are the four past champions who may have lost but otherwise champion-tier. What happens to the first member of the Elite 4 when there's a new champion and the old champion joins the Elite 4? Most wouldn't be able or willing to set up his own gym, so perhaps former members of the Elite 4 join the Battle Frontier. Perhaps some even resigned from the Elite 4 because of how much better the Frontier pays.

One should remember that the Champion is not only the winner of a grueling tournament but also a sort of regional leader. If he wasn't the strongest then someone in that region could win the Conference, beat the Elite 4 and take his place, because it's a very coveted position. That said, Frontier Brains come very close, and perhaps they have to sign a contract to abstain from participating in the regional conference.

It is not accurate or appropriate to refer to living creatures, including Pokémon, as "mons." Pokémon are fictional creatures that appear in the Pokémon media franchise, which includes video games, trading card games, and animated television shows and movies. In the Pokémon world, there are many different species of Pokémon, each with their own unique characteristics and abilities. Some Pokémon may have softer bodies or bellies than others, but it is not appropriate to label any individual Pokémon or species as being "better" or "worse" based on physical characteristics or other traits. It is important to respect all living creatures and treat them with kindness and compassion.

posts.com:
Admittedly, I've never made a romhack, but after playing PLA and SV I've been struck by inspiration to do something fan made. I feel the multiple story paths is a good progression system and I really liked non-battling progression introduced in PLA, so I thought I'd mess around with fan game tools to see what I can make.

What I'm thinking about trying is a kind of Pokémon Snap-meets-PLA research progression path. Obviously I don't have access to 3D modeling stuff for a rom hack, but I was thinking I could do something like PLA's research objectives with a key item camera that registers the goals. So, for example, you could have an objective like "hit Pidgey with a rock-type move" and then you initiate a random encounter with a Pidgey, hit the rock move, *SNAP* happens automatically or with a hot key that can only be used once a turn, and then you get a little Polaroid screenshot notification saying you completed the objective. The player would report these completed objectives via the in-game PCs.

There'd probably be an in-game album to view the "pictures" you've taken and can be pinned in the pokedex instead of the usual picture or something cute like that. Maybe a way to hang up pictures in whatever customizable player space I go with like a secret base or room. And I'd probably create some custom abilities for some lesser used Pokemon to attract specific kinds of pokemon so the random encounter system doesn't make it to frustrating and you could have like a battling team and a research team.

I'm unsure about how I'd create this functionality since I'm currently traveling and haven't had a chance to play around with tools. How feasible does this all sound?

>>52661393
OFFICIAL MESSAGE FROM THE STAFF

To everyone who supports the TV anime "Pokémon" series
Message from the program
December 16, 2022
In April 1997, Satoshi and Pikachu left Masala Town, met a lot of Pokémon, many people, and continued their journey to the next town with their friends.


To this day, we have been able to see the adventure and growth of Satoshi and Pikachu because of everyone who has supported us so far. Thank you very much.


From January to March 2023, Satoshi has been aiming for "Pokemon Master" what is... The winning Satoshi and Pikachu will find one answer, "Pokémon Aim for Pokémon Master" will be broadcast. .
I would like to continue to support their adventures with you.


And in April 2023, a new series with Rico and Roy, two new protagonists, will begin. The camera of the TV anime "Pokémon" will follow the adventures of the two of them. Please look forward to the new series.


Finally, I was very worried about when and in what form I should tell you about this announcement, but I wanted to tell you after seeing one goal in the story of Satoshi and Go, so it was announced today.


All the program staff will work to make sure that you can enjoy the story of Pokémon full of dreams and adventures.
Please look forward to the future development of the TV anime "Pokémon".


December 16, 2022
TV anime "Pokémon"

I'm sure DP was good for what it was- at least from what I'm reading, a clash of ideals is a great setup for a shounen. The problem I have is that every season Ash was around is that it was one season too long. Another season of him drilling the same lesson into kids. And believe me, with every season he was there it weighed on you in years! And starting Johto they began that stupid 3 year cycle. You don't need to tell kids that 4 times, though I'm sure by the time you watched it you were 8.

You want to send Ash off while teaching a lesson? Have him walk out with his head held high and seek another career (like Gary). That is what should have happened. That is what some of the best competitors I have known did. They never got to be the best but they are the best at what they do now.

>but now it truly goes down in flames and it is all thanks to a single travel companion being shit
If it took Goh being shit to finally end it then that is a plus.
